newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee dips on overseas dollar strength.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee dips on overseas dollar strength.

text.p: The Sri Lanka rupee fell against the dollar in early Thursday trading after the Central Bank revalued the greenback on its strength, dealers said.
At 0445 GMT the rupee was at 59.30 to the dollar, after opening at 59.20.

"The rupee was untraded at 59.20 until the Central Bank pushed up the dollar by three cents," said a Citibank dealer. "In the frenzy that followed, the rupee fell to 59.33, but rowed back when banks began selling dollars."
The Central Bank pushed up the dollar by three local cents, mainly on gains against sterling and fixed buying and selling prices at 58.2219 and 59.3981.
Dealers said the rupee could fall again because a state bank had begun to cover an import bill.
Overnight call money rates were steady at 9.50 percent, dealers said.
